result.execSummary:
The defendant Julie A Carroll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied.  Fine paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Julie A Carroll

records.addlTxt:
3:01 PM Defendant Julie A Carroll in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Julie A Carroll.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
FINE: $ 267.50
	
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid immediately after court today.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Alliance Counselling Center Letter dated 9/21/22, filed by Atty. Kershek.

Letter from Alliance Counseling Center dated 9-21-22 re: Defendant completed 16 week program.

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on September 23, 2022 - Document Reviewed.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 10:45 am.

09:11 AM Defendant Julie A Carroll in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Signature bond signed, filed by Atty. Kershek.
Letter from Atty. Kershek re: Retained by Defendant.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:25 AM Defendant Julie A Carroll in court with attorney Steven Hughes and Attorney Mark Kershek.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Hughes states that the Defenadant hired attorney Kershek and requests to withdraw.
The Defendant does not object.
The Court withdraws attorney Hughes.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
